snippet: Eight prominent members of the racing industry told a Senate committee that trainers should be banned for life if they are found to have used potent performance-enhancing drugs.
abstract: Eight prominent members of the horse racing industry tell a Senate committee that trainers should be banned for life if they are found to have used potent performance-enhancing drugs on horses.

byline.original: By WALT BOGDANICH and JOE DRAPE

lead_paragraph: Eight prominent members of the racing industry told a Senate committee that trainers should be banned for life if they are found to have used potent performance-enhancing drugs.

headline.seo: At Senate Hearing, Calls for Strict Discipline on Doping in Horses
headline.main: At Senate Hearing, Calls for Strict Discipline on Doping in Horses
headline.print_headline: Calls for Strict Discipline On Doping of Racehorses

keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
keywords.name: organizations
